intro: Echium rifeum, commonly known as the red thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and tall, erect stems that bear clusters of vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its striking appearance and ecological importance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Echium rifeum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
